member.name: M:ImageResizer.Plugins.AzureReader.AzureReader.Pipeline_PostRewrite(System.Web.IHttpModule,System.Web.HttpContext,ImageResizer.Configuration.IUrlEventArgs)
member.summary: In case there is no querystring attached to the file (thus no operations on the fly) we can redirect directly to the blob. This let us take advantage of the CDN (if configured).

member.name: M:ImageResizer.Plugins.AzureReader.AzureReader.GetIssues
member.summary: Provides the diagnostics system with a list of configuration issues

member.name: P:ImageResizer.Plugins.AzureReader.AzureReader.FailedToRegisterVpp
member.summary: True if the provider attempted to register itself as a VirtualPathProvider and failed due to limited security clearance. False if it did not attempt, or if it succeeded.

member.name: P:ImageResizer.Plugins.AzureReader.AzureReader.RegisterAsVirtualPathProvider
member.summary: True to register the plugin as VPP, false to register it as a VIP. VIPs are only visible to the ImageResizer pipeline - i.e, only processed images are visible.

member.name: M:ImageResizer.Plugins.AzureReader.AzureVirtualPathProvider.IsPathVirtual(System.String)
member.summary: Determines whether a specified virtual path is within the virtual file system.
member.returns: True if the virtual path is within the virtual file sytem; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:ImageResizer.Plugins.AzureReader.AzureVirtualPathProvider.FileExists(System.String,System.Collections.Specialized.NameValueCollection)
member.summary: Returns true if the specified file is within the azure virtual directory prefix, and if it exists. Returns true even if the file doesn't exist when LazyExistenceCheck=true

member.name: P:ImageResizer.Plugins.AzureReader.AzureVirtualPathProvider.VirtualFilesystemPrefix
member.summary: Requests starting with this path will be handled by this virtual path provider. Can be in app-relative form: "~/azure/". Will be translated to domain-relative form.

member.name: M:ImageResizer.Plugins.AzureReader.AzureFile.Open
member.summary: Attempts to download the blob into a MemoryStream instance and return it. Throws a FileNotFoundException if the blob doesn't exist.
